and snap it) (Comrie 1985: 333)

tier.item: b. Áalkab-il h úuch u bin.
Alternatively, the verb p'áat `leave', `abandon' might be used instead of bin. The source of p'áat
can be specified by an adjunct, but p'áat is far less frequent in narratives. Notice, though, that (28) is a
constructed example and that I'm not entirely sure how native speaker would translate (27) out of
context.
EVENT REPRESENTATION - Some primordial soup 19
run-REL PRV happen(b.3.SG) A.3 go
`In a running manner he left, i.e. he rán away.'
b. Áalkab-il h úuch u bin.

constructed example and that I'm not entirely sure how native speaker would translate (27) out of
context.

tier.item: (42) Káa h ts'o'k u bin Carrillo Juan-e',
CON PRV end(B.3.SG) A.3 go Carrillo Juan-TOP
káa h k'uch Señor-e',
CON PRV arrive(B.3.SG) Señor-TOP
káa t-uy il-ah Pablo-i'.
CON PRV-A.3 see-CMP(B.3.SG) Pablo-D4
Káa t-y-a'l-ah-o', ma' k'uch-uk Carrillo-i'.
CON PRV-A.3-say-CMP(B.3.SG)-D2 NEG arrive-SUBJ(B.3.SG) Carrillo-D4
`(When) Pedro had gone to(wards) (the town of Felipe) Carrillo (Puerto), he arrived in
(the village of Señor, (when) he met Pablo there. At this moment (lit. (when) it said
that), he had not yet arrived in Carrillo.'

tier.item: (50) Juan esta-ba yendo desde México a Guadalajara,
Juan was-IMPF.3.SG go.GER from México to Guadalajara
cuando el autobus se estrope-ó,
when the bus REFL damage-PRV.3.SG
y result-ó que tuv-o que regres-ar a México.
a nd result-PRV.3.SG SR have.PRV-3.SG SR return-INF to México
`Juan was going from México to Guadalajara, when the bus broke down and he had to
return to México.' (Enrique Palancar p.c.)

tier.item: (63) Túun mèet-ik u súut u mehen yàanta-il-o'b.
PROG:A.3 make-INC(B.3.SG) [A.3 turn/ATP A.3 young tire-REL-PL]S
Causative péek-s with an animate theme is possible in a reflexive construction, i.e. when theme
and agent are coreferential.
Selection among the two causative verbs in this construction seems to be a matter of dialect. For
perimissive causation, ch'a' `let' is used.
EVENT REPRESENTATION - Some primordial soup 37
`She's making [the toy truck's] little tires turn.' (Everest II/5 ram)
(63) Túun mèet-ik u súut u mehen yàanta-il-o'b.
PROG:A.3 make-INC(B.3.SG) [A.3 turn/ATP A.3 young tire-REL-PL]S

and agent are coreferential.
Selection among the two causative verbs in this construction seems to be a matter of dialect. For
perimissive causation, ch'a' `let' is used.
